title: Path of electron in magnetic field

content.description: An electron is traveling with speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when it enters a uniform magnetic field that is directed into the page, as shown above. Five paths in the magnetic field are labeled <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which labeled path best shows the path the electron will follow as it travels through the magnetic field?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
